definition: king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great

sentences.english: We could, at long last, have a trump card to play against Darwin.
sentences.chinese: 最终，我们就有了自己的王牌，可以叫板达尔文。

sentences.english: For Hearts, you may want to know how many trump cards are still in play.
sentences.chinese: 对于红心大战，您可能需要知道游戏中还有多少王牌。

sentences.english: But in his final words I found an ace that I could keep.
sentences.chinese: 但从他最后的话语中我找到了我可以珍存的王牌。

sentences.english: A diamond lead allows a ruff in dummy.
sentences.chinese: 打方块牌，名家就可以出王牌压。

sentences.english: The ultimate sales machine : turbocharge your business with relentless focus on 12 key strategies.
sentences.chinese: 其他书名王牌业务主管的关键12力。

sentences.english: Mr. Smith is not good at acing up his sleeve.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生不擅长最后打出王牌。

sentences.english: Good to put West to his trumps.
One advantage is that she can play a waiting game.
sentences.chinese: 她还有一张王牌就是她可以伺机下手，枕戈待旦。

sentences.english: Ace of Cakes star Duff Goldman was a couple of tables away.
sentences.chinese: 蛋糕王牌大明星达夫高盛是情侣对表。

sentences.english: He's smart to ruff a spade AT trick one.
sentences.chinese: 他在打第一墩时用王牌压黑桃，这很聪明。

sentences.english: He knows something about the boss-that is his ace in the hole.
sentences.chinese: 他了解老板的一些事情，那是他应急时要打出的王牌。

sentences.english: He knows something about the bo -that is his ace in the hole .
sentences.chinese: 他了解老板的一些事情，那是他应急时要打出的王牌。

sentences.english: Whenit comes to business success, morning people hold the important cards.
sentences.chinese: 当谈及工作，早晨类型的人手上握有王牌。

definition: old, well-known brand/old style/old school/an old hand/experienced veteran
cards in one's hand/(fig.) undisclosed strength or information/hidden trump
main assault/to focus on/to specialize in/to major in
to be known as/to be nicknamed/to be purportedly/to claim (often exaggeratedly or falsely)
to drop from the sky/(fig.) to appear out of nowhere/(attributive) airborne
